activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Lee Sturdevant

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

10:53 AM/11:02AM  Defendant Kevin Lee Sturdevant in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to counsel freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver.
Calendar Call scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kevin Lee Sturdevant appeared by phone. Not guilty plea entered by Defendant. Matter to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:52 PM Defendant Kevin Lee Sturdevant in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Taylor E Klokow by video.  Mason C Braunschweig and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $150 Signature bond with conditions: No violent or disorderly conduct with victim A.S. or B.S. Absolute Sobriety. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
No violent or disorderly conduct with victim AS or BS. Absolute Sobriety.
